channel.title: Deferred on Newton Evolution Proposals (NEPs)
channel.description: Recent content in Deferred on Newton Evolution Proposals (NEPs)

item.title: Newton Composite Asset (NCA)
item.description: Simple Summary # Newton Composite Asset (NCA) is the base pattern of asset combination that defines the boundary of how two or more than two assets are combined as a single instance. NCA distinguishes from the other types of asset by involving more than one NEAT. Every NCA is defined based on the principle of Behavioral Equivalence 1, so that unique properties of NCA can be distinguished computationally and therefore maximize the possibility of code reuse and automated asset valuation.
